intro: Adenophora remotiflora f. oreophila, commonly known as the alpine adenophora, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, showcasing adaptations to cold and harsh environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid conditions. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
